channel.name: How do you get a transaction's status programmatically?

messages.content: The operation the transaction performs does not modify the state but I'd like to know whether the transaction has completed.

I suspect you can poll the graphql proxy for the transaction status, but I'm not sure if there's a better way.  I'd be interested to see what Gareth or one of the O1 team says.

I think in the same vein as watching the transaction would be watching for events or actions on an account.  The docs are great for writing the contract, but not clear on the API to watch what happens on chain.
we have something like `tx.wait()`, which is supposed to wait for the tx to be included in a block - but that hasn't been implemented yet
I guess the easiest way, just like @45930 said, would be to poll the graphql endpoint and wait for success
Is this going to be some websocket kind to even subscription? Will that also expand to emitted events?
Potentially, ye. Although I am unsure if we have any concrete plans just yet

embeds.title: implement `tx.wait()` by Trivo25 · Pull Request #645 · o1-labs/sna...
embeds.description:
implements tx.wait() to programmatically wait for a transactions inclusion in a block
closes #396

messages.content: Should be available with the next snarkyjs version
